[30;1m630 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m631 | [0m[35m    Note that on top of the default password policy fields, we also add an extra key,[0m

   Pattern: [32m\.(request|post|get)\([0m
[30;1m1461 | [0m[35m    def matches_filter(self, config):[0m
[30;1m1462 | [0m[35m        key_set = [key for key in self.keys if key in self.data][0m
[30;1m1463 | [0m[35m        if key_set:[0m
[30;1m1464 | [0m[35m            return all([self.data.get(key) is config[key] for key in key_set])[0m
[30;1m1465 | [0m[35m        else:[0m
[30;1m1466 | [0m[35m            return not all(config.values())[0m
[30;1m1467 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m800 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m801 | [0m[35m    def get_tag_delta(self, source, target):[0m
[30;1m802 | [0m[35m        source_tags = {t['Key']: t['Value'] for t in source.get('Tags', ())}[0m
[30;1m803 | [0m[35m        target_tags = {t['Key']: t['Value'] for t in target.get('Tags', ())}[0m
[30;1m804 | [0m[35m        target_keys = set(target_tags.keys())[0m
[30;1m805 | [0m[35m        source_keys = set(source_tags.keys())[0m

[30;1m1400 | [0m[35m    By default, this filter matches a security group rule if[0m
[30;1m1401 | [0m[35m    _all_ of its keys match. Using `match-operator: or` causes a match[0m
[30;1m1402 | [0m[35m    if _any_ key matches. This can help consolidate some simple[0m
[30;1m1403 | [0m[35m    cases that would otherwise require multiple filters. To find[0m
[30;1m1404 | [0m[35m    security groups that allow all inbound traffic over IPv4 or IPv6,[0m
[30;1m1405 | [0m[35m    for example, we can use two filters inside an `or` block:[0m
[30;1m1406 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m1407 | [0m[35m    .. code-block:: yaml[0m

[30;1m1182 | [0m[35m@SecurityGroup.filter_registry.register('stale')[0m

[30;1m1184 | [0m[35m    """Filter to find security groups that contain stale references[0m

[30;1m1059 | [0m[35m    We scan all extant enis in the vpc to get a baseline set of groups[0m

[30;1m172 | [0m[35m            resource.get('Engine', '') == 'mysql'):[0m

[30;1m403 | [0m[35m@ASG.filter_registry.register('invalid')[0m
[30;1m404 | [0m[35mclass InvalidConfigFilter(ConfigValidFilter):[0m
[30;1m405 | [0m[35m    """Filter autoscale groups to find those that are structurally invalid.[0m
[30;1m406 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m158 | [0m[35m    # We systematically use a start time of 24h ago. This means the min period is always 60 seconds.[0m

[30;1m362 | [0m[35m    This action can optionally setup the resource permissions needed for[0m
[30;1m363 | [0m[35m    route53 to log to cloud watch logs via `set-permissions: true`, else[0m

[30;1m365 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m366 | [0m[35m    Its recommended to use a separate custodian policy on the log[0m
[30;1m367 | [0m[35m    groups to set the log retention period for the zone logs. See[0m

[30;1m44 | [0m[35m - **onhour**: the default time to start/run resources, specified as 0-23[0m
[30;1m45 | [0m[35m - **offhour**: the default time to stop/suspend resources, specified as 0-23[0m
[30;1m46 | [0m[35m - **skip-days**: a list of dates to skip. Dates must use format YYYY-MM-DD[0m
[30;1m47 | [0m[35m - **skip-days-from**: a list of dates to skip stored at a url. **expr**,[0m
[30;1m48 | [0m[35m   **format**, and **url** must be passed as parameters. Same syntax as[0m
[30;1m49 | [0m[35m   ``value_from``. Can not specify both **skip-days-from** and **skip-days**.[0m
[30;1m50 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m76 | [0m[35mThe value of the tag must be one of the following:[0m
[30;1m77 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m78 | [0m[35m- **(empty)** or **on** - An empty tag value or a value of "on" implies night[0m
[30;1m79 | [0m[35m  and weekend offhours using the default time zone configured in the policy[0m
[30;1m80 | [0m[35m  (tz=est if unspecified) and the default onhour and offhour values configured[0m
[30;1m81 | [0m[35m  in the policy.[0m
[30;1m82 | [0m[35m- **off** - If offhours is configured to run in opt-out mode, this tag can be[0m
